reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent two nights here on our trip through Spain and Portugal. I have nothing bad to say of our stay here. Our Junior Suite was perfect. The private, at the door, parking spot is unheard of in European hotels. The suite was large, the beds comfortable and quiet. We didn't have much of a view but after being on the road for several weeks, we welcomed our ability to spread out and relaxed. We walked into Santiago one morning and found that no issue. It was too early in the season for the pool to be open. Breakfast was fine as it ticked all the usual boxes. The price was really quite reasonable for what we got in value and comfort. We can easily recommend this property.
reviews.title: What A Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very good hotel outside the center of Santiago.
reviews.title: Excelent if you have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay in a family friendly hotel. A nice surprise.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Spacious Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Best Hotel Value in Santiago de Compostela

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: If you speak Spanish it would probably be a great place to stay. Since I don't, I would not recommend. Lobby bar service is scarce. Have walked out on a couple of bills because I couldn't find anyone to pay. However, the restaurant downstairs is very quick to bring the bill, usually in the middle of the meal. No consistency, advertised a airport shuttle. There is none and any one who may speak English becomes disinterested if you complain. Definitely a no go in my book
reviews.title: If you speak Spanish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A modern impressive hotel between the airport and the city and near Monte Gozo the pilgrims first view of the city. Very comfortable rooms with good bathrooms, excellent buffet breakfast, plenty of free parking. A shuttle bus which takes you in and out of the city centre near the old town from 9 a.m. Until 8.30 p.m. (The driver is a mine of local information) On demand. Beautiful landscaped gardens and outdoor swimming pool.
reviews.title: Ideal base for Santiago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was HUGE! And we slept in complete silence and comfort. The beds are great, the temperature in the room was perfect and the hallway was quiet. Very fancy and posh. The receptionists are friendly and helpful and most speak English quiet well. The shuttle to town made the 2 KM trip convenient and the driver gave us very useful information about getting around town and what sites to visit. Brkfst wasn't cheap, but they did have some egg choices besides the usual European fare.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is located in monte do gozo, the main entrance of pilgrims to Santiago de Compostela. Very easy to reach from the main motorway routes and sorrounded by forests, the hotel offers high quality rooms and services, far away from noise and stress. The monumental area is quite far if you want to walk, but if you travel with car there are several parking lots by the city centre easy to access. Enjoy the food: it is superb. I strongly recomend "pote gallego" to recover energies at lunch.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for easy pilgrimage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I loved this hotel and stayed there at the end of the Camino to rest and recuperate. It is a lovely location, just on the outskirts of the city on a hill. There is a free shuttle into and out of the city, which is really great. Breakfast was good, and room service was ok too. Food and drinks are quite expensive though, although the rate for the room was good. The staff on the front desk could have done with going back to charm school, particularly when speaking English. There were two of us and I speak Spanish, but the other person didn't, so that was what brought the abruptness to the fore. I needed to see a doctor when I was there, at a cost of ninety euro. They phoned the doctor for me at reception, so that was very helpful. There is a computer just off reception with internet access, which was useful.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hotel situated on the outskirts of the city which exemplifies luxury. From the moment we arrived, the hotel provided great service and smiles all round.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Santiago de Compostela

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable, and felt more like an apartment at times. The hotel is a good 45 minute walk to the old town, but there is a very convenient free shuttle service which drops you off in town and picks you up to take you back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant is very classy and the food sublime. Unfortunately we did not get an opportunity to see the gardens, but I heard they are beautiful.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are staying in Santiago, and are looking for a luxury stay, this is the place.
reviews.title: Good for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great room; food not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Can't beat it; a family room with enough space, great service, and free shuttle to the city for just under 75 Euros! The place is great, meets the full four stars. The staff is very friendly; the shuttle service when you need it works great (extra points for the driver). The restaurant is good, however is expensive (when compared to what you can get in town).
reviews.title: Hotel Los Abetos - A place for family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Be careful with noise as insulation is not great and you might hear the guests from rooms around if they are noisy.
reviews.title: What an incredible hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a gem just outside of Santiago de Compostela. There is nothing bad to say about this place. The hotel is situated outside the city on a hilltop. There is free ample parking. Once you park, just leave your car because the hotel staff will take you into the city with one of their minivans. Just call them when you want to return and they will pick you up. This service is complimentary. The rooms are fabulous. We stayed in a Jr. Suite and it was the nicest room that we stayed in all of Spain. The bath jacuzzi was wonderful and relaxing after a day of walking Santiago. Breakfast was incredible. The manager asked us if we wanted any egg dishes in addition to a large breakfast buffet. They aimed to please. The staff was very attentive.
reviews.title: Comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I really liket Los Abetos. The surroundings of the hotel are really relaxing and beautiful. The views are really nice too. The lobby is big, with lots of seating areas all over the hotel, great to hang out with friends. Breakfast is really good. The quality of the cooking there is not so great. I mean, the food is well made, the meat is tender, but the seasoning wasn't my taste at all.
reviews.title: We finally reached Santiago De Compostela

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are big and clean, really sunny. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom is good. Our tub was kind of clogged and the problem couldn't be solved while we were there, so the cleaning lady came and tried to unclog it... no succes.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Strategic position
